id: Environmentalists must embrace nuclear power to stem climate change

Other green groups should follow suit, says Mark LynasLeroy Francis/GettyBy Mark LynasChanging your mind on a controversial topic isn’t easy, especially when you have spent decades campaigning against your new position. Which is why the decision by the Union of Concerned Scientists (UCS) to drop its long-standing opposition to nuclear power is so important, and why the organisation deserves great credit for having the courage to take this step.The UCS has broken with the anti-nuclear ideology that has been part of the advocacy group’s DNA since the 1960s.
